content: In the following questions, I will provide a target Python program code. The code is a program containing a loop, and the purpose of the code is indicated by its function name. Please provide a loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the loop to prove the partial correctness of the program. The loop invariant should be written in the form 'xxx_value = fun(arr[xxx]->arr[xxx])'. (Please note that your answer should only contain statements in the specified format without any additional text.)

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the `find_max` function is:

`max_value_i = find_max(arr[i] -> arr[i])`

This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is always the maximum value in the array. It ensures that the loop continues to iterate correctly and that the maximum value is updated correctly each iteration.

The loop invariant for the i-th iteration of the `find_max` function is:

`max_value_i = find_max(arr[i] -> arr[i+1])`

This invariant ensures that the maximum value found so far is always the maximum value in the array excluding the current index. It ensures that the loop continues to iterate correctly and that the maximum value is updated correctly each iteration.
